forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 22. Southwest wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 43, with temperatures falling to around 40 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 3 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday Night
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 1am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 30, with temperatures rising to around 35 overnight. South southwest wind 2 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.snowAmount: New snow accumulation of 1 to 2 inches possible
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 1pm, then rain and snow between 1pm and 4pm, then rain and snow. Cloudy, with a high near 38. North northeast wind 2 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New snow accumulation of 1 to 2 inches possible.

sections.header: Stony Creek Cross Country Ski Rental:
sections.content: Open this weekend January 25th and 26th from 10 a.m. until 5 p.m. (final rental at 4 p.m.) Ski rentals can be booked ahead https://www.metroparks.com/stony-creek-metropark/#cross-country_skiing.  Trails will not be groomed at this time.

Bucks Run 2.5 km ski trail will be groomed for skate and classic skiing today, January 29, 2025. There is an additional $5 daily trail fee for the use of Bucks Run or annual permits are available for $125.  Dogs and walkers are not permitted on our groomed trails.

sections.header: Natural Snow Classic and Skate Ski Trails
sections.content: – Golf course trails, Hawk Hills and Coyote Run, were rolled on January 24, 2025.  When skiing the golf course trails please ski on designated marked trails only.  All other trails have not been groomed due to very limited snowfall.

Huron Meadows Metropark (Brighton).conditions: Team NordicSkiRacer instructors were out in force this evening, teaching kids to "duck walk" (herringbone) and ski like a pizza slice (snowplow)! Snow conditions were great with a firm skate surface and deep tracks with a little loose snow on them to make classic skiing pretty good.

Nubs Nob (Harbor Springs).conditions: The red & blue trails were groomed up nicely after yesterday's snowfall. We skate skied both this morning while the current round of snow was falling which slowed things down a lot.

nubsNob.liftsOpen: At least 5 lifts and the rope tow
nubsNob.xcTrails: Trails are open and will be groomed and tracked this morning.
nubsNob.nightSkiing: Tuesday through Saturday from 5:30 to 9:00 PM.
nubsNob.comments: It just keeps snowing at Nub's Nob. Three more inches of snow fell on the slopes yesterday afternoon. The new snow was tilled into the base and conditions should be great for skiing and riding today. The wind is up from the Northwest this morning and should calm down considerably by the afternoon. The lifts will spin from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM today with an hour break at 4:30 PM so we can prepare for night skiing. Make it a great day at Nub's Nob!
